channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Netflix shares jump 11% after third-quarter earnings beat
item.description: Netflix saw momentum in its ad-supported membership tier, which surged 35% quarter over quarter.

item.title: Stellantis to sell, shutter large testing facility amid cost-cutting efforts
item.description: Stellantis' Arizona Proving Grounds covers 4,000 acres between Phoenix and Las Vegas in Yucca, Arizona.

item.title: Procter & Gamble earnings beat estimates, but weak demand in China hurts sales
item.description: Procter & Gamble said volume fell in its Greater China market despite the earnings beat.

item.title: Germany’s auto giants are struggling to stay relevant
item.description: Germany's automotive sector, long recognized for producing high-quality cars, is struggling to preserve its relevance in the age of electrification.

item.title: China needs stimulus with 'beautiful deleveraging' to avoid debt crisis, says Ray Dalio
item.description: China must employ a “beautiful deleveraging” in addition to its recent stimulus measures in order to avoid debt crisis, says Ray Dalio.

item.title: Spirit AeroSystems to furlough 700 workers as Boeing machinist strike continues
item.description: Spirit AeroSystems had been scrambling to cut costs after more than 32,000 Boeing machinists walked off the job Sept. 13.

item.title: Tesla faces NHTSA investigation of ‘Full Self-Driving’ after fatal collision
item.description: Tesla faces a new U.S. probe concerning its "Full Self-Driving" systems, and whether they are safe to use in "reduced roadway visibility conditions."

item.title: After rejecting Google takeover, cyber firm Wiz says it will IPO 'when the stars align'
item.description: Wiz is hoping to achieve $1 billion in annual recurring revenue in 2025 — a key condition the company wants to meet before going public.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The changing face of India's rich
item.description: The Tatas, Ambanis and Adanis have long been the face of India's wealthy population. That is changing as India's rich populace gets a new identity.

item.title: Amazon cloud boss says employees unhappy with 5-day office mandate can leave
item.description: Amazon's cloud boss on Thursday told employees who are unhappy with the company's new five-day in-office mandate they can leave for other companies.

item.title: Op-ed: The financial toxicity of cancer is growing. Here's what can be done to reduce it
item.description: For the first time in history, more than two million Americans will receive a new cancer diagnosis in 2024, and that is creating significant financial hardship.

item.title: Why some families will pay $500,000 for Ivy League admissions consulting: 'It’s worth the investment'
item.description: To get a leg up in the competitive world of college admissions, some families are spending half a million dollars or more on private consultants.

item.title: IMF chief warns 'not yet time to celebrate' as low growth and high debt weigh on global economy
item.description: The head of the International Monetary Fund cautioned on Thursday that high government debt and low growth remained major impediments to the global economy.

item.title: Historic bitcoin theft tied to Connecticut kidnapping, luxury cars, $500K bar bills
item.description: The kidnapping of a Connecticut couple has been linked to one of the biggest thefts of cryptocurrency from an individual in United States history.

item.title: Overseas UK territories are the ‘biggest enablers of corporate tax abuse,’ tax advocacy group says
item.description: British overseas territories are the world's top enablers of corporate tax abuse, according to a ranking by tax advocacy group Tax Justice Network.

item.title: Intel seeks billions for minority stake in Altera business, sources say
item.description: This move that would represent a sharp about-face from its earlier public messaging about the larger company's prospects.

item.title: Netflix third-quarter subscribers barely beat estimates as ad-tier members jump 35%
item.description: Netflix's ad-tier memberships jumped 35%. The company is on track to launch the service in Canada in the coming quarter and more broadly in 2025.

item.title: More Trump sealed files released in Jack Smith Jan. 6 election case
item.description: The records were made public after Judge Tanya Chutkan denied a request by Trump's lawyers to keep them sealed until after the Nov. 5 presidential election.

item.title: Google CEO names new search and ads boss, slides predecessor to role of chief technologist
item.description: Google is replacing Prabhakar Raghavan, the company's search and ads boss since 2018, with longtime executive Nick Fox.

item.title: China pledges more financial support for 'whitelist' real estate projects
item.description: Ni Hong, China's minister of housing and urban-rural development, made the announcement at a press conference on Thursday.

item.title: FBI arrests Alabama man for SEC X hack that spiked price of bitcoin
item.description: Eric Council Jr. is accused of conspiracy in the hack of the Securities and Exchange Commission X account that tweeted a false claim about bitcoin.

item.title: Amazon makes first foray into live news with election night special hosted by Brian Williams
item.description: The company plans to host a one-night special with live election results and analysis on its Prime Video streaming service.

item.title: The solid-state batteries hype is fading – prompting auto giants to consider alternatives
item.description: Despite the hype around solid-state batteries, some analysts believe an alternative could serve as a bridge between these are traditional lithium-ion batteries.

item.title: Auto giants launch a flurry of cheaper electric vehicles — taking the fight to China
item.description: Europe's top carmakers unveiled low-cost EVs at the Paris Motor Show this week, seeking to recapture some of the market share held by Chinese brands.

item.title: Nvidia and Apple supplier TSMC shares pop after quarterly profit soars on AI demand
item.description: TSMC, the world’s largest producer of advanced chips, posted a 54% hike in third-quarter profit.

item.title: Retail sales rose 0.4% in September, better than expected; jobless claims dip
item.description: Consumer spending held up in September, underscoring a resilient economy.

item.title: UK regulator warns of big fines, service suspensions for tech giants ahead of new safety rules
item.description: Technology giants could face "significant" fines if they don't comply with the U.K.'s internet safety regulations, the British media regulator Ofcom warned Thursday.

item.title: UK's ultra-rich non-doms urge Italian-style tax regime to prevent wealth exodus
item.description: Britain's ultra-rich non-doms are urging the government to introduce an Italian-style flat-tax regime to prevent a wealth exodus as their preferential status comes under threat in the budget.

item.title: A tough new EU cyber law is off to a messy start, with many countries failing to adopt the rules
item.description: New European Union rules requiring businesses to bolster their cyber defenses are already off to a messy start.

item.title: Intel faces headwinds in China as trade body calls for security probe
item.description: Intel products have been recommended for a security review by a trade group in China which alleges they pose vulnerabilities and risks to national security.
